page.title: 05LANIVET PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The church is in the centre of the village opposite the school. The earliest religious building on the site was probably a celtic monastery though this may have been at nearby Lamorick.A church stood on the site in Norman times but the church of today is a restored fifteenth century building.The first rector is listed, however, in{1259. The church was restored in{1865.}It has a square tower housing bells, large perpendicular windows and six interior arches made of St.Stephen's stone.Lanivet is part of the{Bodmin} team ministry and it has a daughter church in Nanstallon.Communion, family services and evensong are the regular services.The Rev. Tony Olivey is a welcome visitor at the school each week. {
